intro: Bulbostylis trifida, commonly known as the three-lobed bulbostylis, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the grass family (Poaceae). It is characterized by its delicate, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wet, marshy habitats, often in tropical and subtropical regions. Its flowers are usually pale green or white, and it produces small, three-lobed seed capsules. Bulbostylis trifida is often found in association with other wetland vegetation, contributing to the ecological diversity of such environments.
